p: We begin with an initial set of m uniformly random parameter configurations according to ( 1). Based on initial runs, we choose to work with m = 1000. Full simulations are carried out at these 1000 configurations to obtain simulated regional attack sizes and peak timings. We then perform the two-stage calibration procedure described earlier, to obtain a MAP estimate of the best parameter configuration. For the gaussian likelihood (see S1 Appendix. Additional methods on Calibration methodology), we defined independent errors with a standard deviation of 20% around the calibration criteria [ 30]. While varying the standard deviation may affect the posterior distribution, it is to be noted that the MAP estimator remains unaffected.
